container.heading: Interference with Approved Powerboat Races, Regattas, or Exhibitions

section.heading: Purpose.
section.text: The purpose of these regulations is to foster water safety in an area where an approved powerboat race, regatta, or exhibition is taking place.

para.text: The following terms have the meanings indicated.

"Approved powerboat races, regattas, or exhibitions" means an event that takes place on the waters of the State that has prior written approval from the United States Coast Guard or the Department of Natural Resources.
"Course" means the water areas necessary to safely conduct a powerboat race, regatta, or exhibition. The area is usually marked by buoys, but other methods may be employed.
"Interference" means any entry into the course of an approved powerboat race, regatta, or exhibition by a non-participant.
Operate or cause to be operated an unauthorized vessel across an approved powerboat race, regatta, or exhibition course, or cause interference with an approved race, regatta, or exhibition.
Swim across the boundary of an approved race, regatta, or exhibition course.

annotations.annotation: Natural Resources Article, §8-704, Annotated Code of Maryland
